intro: Freycinetia mariannensis var. microsyncarpia, commonly known as the Micronesian freycinetia, is a rare flowering plant native to the islands of Micronesia. It belongs to the Pandanaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, strap-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences with inconspicuous flowers, followed by cylindrical, berry-like fruits that are typically green when mature. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal or lowland forests. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species.
